content.description: Start on the low right sidepull on the side of the roof, and left hand sidepull crimp under the roof, crank off the ground to gain the sloper on the right face and move into the start of Solaire, then finish the climb as per the V6 variation. To link the sit start you can throw right to the sloper or go left then drop in right(cross). May be more or less difficult depending on height and/or ape index.
content.location: Sit start to Solaire V6. By trail ending and lookout point. Obvious jutting roof just off trail.

content.description: Start right hand on a sloper and left hand sidepull on a crimp in the roof. Set a toe-hook with the right foot and use leverage to pull yourself up to the sloping edges above, then set your hands on the sharp fins, cut feet and squeeze hard! Fun climb, great holds and difficult enough to put in a few good sessions.There is a sit start that adds a few hard moves.
content.location: Approx. 120 feet North-east of the intersection of the trail that loops around north of the campground. Right next to the trail ending that becomes a lookout point. Follow the trail until it splits, the boulder is a striking low roof, easily visible from the trails.
